result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:23 am cases called-15CF73, 15CM93, & 17CF84. Defendant Michael S Greenwald in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motions filed by counsel and questions how the matters will proceed. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding joinder discussion and declaration to reject the plea offer from the State. Further statement by Attorney Lennon regarding trial. Court accepts the rejection of plea offer of the defendant, questions defendant regarding rejection and orders the offer of settlement to be sealed.  Court addresses joinder motion on 17CF84. Statement by Attorney Lennon-does not have any grounds to object to the joinder motion. Court grants motion for joinder of 17CF84 & 15CM93 into 15CF73. Further statement regarding joinder issue and order. ADA Anderson files an Amended Information. Attorney Lennon confirms receipt of Amended Information, waives formal reading and enters pleas of Not Guilty to all counts. Court questions parties regarding balance of motions-906.09 motion requested to be addressed by ADA Anderson. Court addresses motions in limine and will grant all. Court reviews 906.09 motion- finds 12 prior convictions and admits evidence of said convictions. Court discusses prior convictions with defendant and if he were to elect to testify what the correct answer would be and if answered correctly the State would be precluded from asking any further questions regarding prior convictions. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding additional conviction and another motion being filed to include the newest conviction. Court and counsel discuss day of trial. 23 in box, 5 strikes each-1 provisional juror. ADA Anderson makes statement regarding witness list of defense. Attorney Lennon states he will not be filing a witness list.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2017 at 08:00 am.

9:02 am cases called-17CF73, 15CM93, & 17CF84. Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes statement regarding non-appearance of defendant. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding status of defendant-contact with defendant regarding offer being made and conversation with defendant regarding appearance today. Attorney Lennon requests leave to contact defendant regarding status. Court respectfully declines to adjourn matter and issues warrant, Continental US on all matters.
9:29 am cases recalled-Attorney Lennon appears by phone, defendant appears in court & ADA Anderson appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court withdraws warrant previously authorized and questions counsel regarding proceeding. Court addresses defendant and non-appearance. Court questions defendant. Court questions Attorney Lennon. Attorney Lennon makes statement to court and questions defendant-Defendant does not accept the offer of the State. Court reschedules matters for final PTC.
Final pre-trial on October 6, 2017 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: 11:49 am cases called-15CF73, 15CF93, & 17CF84. Defendant Michael S Greenwald in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states clerk's office received a message from Attorney Zamzow regarding withdrawal. Court questions defendant-joins in request for withdrawal of Attorney Zamzow. Court directs defendant to contact SPD for subsequent appointment of counsel. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding appointment and will accept if SPD so wishes.  17CF84- Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Lennon confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters plea of Not Guilty.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2017 at 02:25 pm.

15CM93, 15CF73 & 17CF84 Cases called @ 10:29 a.m. Defendant Michael S Greenwald in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 17CF84 - Defendant is requesting a different attorney on this matter.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  ADA Anderson requesting $5000 Sig Bond. No objection by DE. Court orders $5000 Sig Bond. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. The Court will adjourn the IA pending appointment of an attorney. 15CF73 - Information stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  NG plea entered as to all counts.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2017 at 11:15 am.

from Atty Zamzow, Dated 2/27/2017 Re: Request for Voluntary Appearance and Withdrawal of Warrant - Court will allow VA scheduling, Warrant to remain pending appearance before the Court.

10:20 am cases called- 15CF73 & 15CM93. Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Zamzow-defendant has a pending case in Green Lake County-set for 4/4 return and requests to have matters set after that date-Defendant is considering offers. Statement by Court. Statement by ADA Anderson-today is an in person status-according to Attorney Zamzow defendant is in Florida for a matter pending there-ADA Anderson requests warrant. Further statement by Attorney Zamzow regarding Florida cases. Court authorizes an issuance of warrant and makes statement regarding non-appearance of defendant. Court states Attorney Zamzow may arrange for voluntary appearance and position of defendant regarding offers to prevent extradition costs.

BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2015CF00073 AND 2015CM000093.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Def and SPD Roberts Turner

15CF-73 and 15CM-93 - Both Cases Called @ 1:21 PM: Defendant Michael S Greenwald in court with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner, both appearing via video.  Defendant Michael S Greenwald in custody.  15CM-93 and 15CF-73 - Both Complaints Stated -  Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted by Def - Reading Waived.  SPD confirms eligibility.  ADA argues for $2000 cash bond as to both cases.  SPD argues as to bond request - argues for Signature Bond.  The Court:  Orders $2000 Cash Bond w/conditions.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
